text: Alexander Galbraith "Sandy" Wilson (19 May 1924 â€“ 27 August 2014) was an English composer and lyricist. He was best known for his musical The Boy Friend (1953). Wilson was born in Sale, Cheshire. He studied at the Harrow School and Oriel College, Oxford. Most of his work for the stage was material for revues, such as Hermione Gingold's Slings and Arrows, Laurier Lister's Oranges and Lemons, and See You Later. Wilson died in London, England, aged 90. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Alumni of the University of Oxford Category:English composers Category:Musicians from Cheshire
title: Sandy Wilson
